properties.name: symbol-digit substitution
properties.definition_text: DSST is a neuropsychological test sensitive to brain damage, dementia, age and depression. It isnât sensitive to the location of brain-damage (except for damage comprising part of the visual field). It consists of (e.g. nine) digit-symbol pairs (e.g. 1/-,2/â´ ... 7/Î,8/X,9/=) followed by a list of digits. Under each digit the subject should write down the corresponding symbol as fast as possible. The number of correct symbols within the allowed time (e.g. 90 or 120 sec) is measured.
